botId.title: How to Find Your Bot Basic ID
botId.introduction: Your Bot Basic ID is a unique identifier for your LINE Official Account. It's used to create the "Add Friend" link that allows customers to connect with your bot.
botId.step1Description: Open the LINE Developers Console in a new tab
botId.step2Description: Click on the provider that contains your Messaging API channel
botId.step3Description: Choose the channel associated with your business bot
botId.step4Description: Click on the "Messaging API" tab in the navigation
botId.step5Description: Scroll down to find the "Bot basic ID" field. It will look like this:
botId.step6Description: Copy the Bot Basic ID (including the @ symbol) and paste it into the input field
botId.formatDescription: The Bot Basic ID always starts with @ followed by alphanumeric characters.
botId.needHelpDescription: If you're having trouble finding your Bot Basic ID, check out the official LINE documentation:

token.title: How to Get Your Channel Access Token
token.introduction: Your Channel Access Token is a secret key that allows Kitsune to send messages through your LINE Official Account. Keep this token secure and never share it publicly.
token.step1Description: Open the LINE Developers Console in a new tab
token.step2Description: Click on the provider that contains your Messaging API channel
token.step3Description: Choose the channel associated with your business bot
token.step4Description: Click on the "Messaging API" tab in the navigation
token.step5Description: Scroll down to the "Channel access token (long-lived)" section and click the "Issue" button if you haven't already
token.step6Description: Click the "Copy" button next to your token. The token is a long string of characters.
token.step7Description: Paste the token into the Channel Access Token field in Kitsune
token.securityDescription: This token grants full access to send messages from your LINE Official Account. Never share it publicly or commit it to version control. If you believe your token has been compromised, revoke it immediately in the LINE Developers Console and issue a new one.
token.needHelpDescription: If you're having trouble finding your Channel Access Token, check out the official LINE documentation:

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.subtitle: Your privacy is important to us. This Privacy Policy explains how the Company collects, uses, discloses, and safeguards your information when you use our LINE-based booking platform.
privacy.jurisdiction: This Privacy Policy applies to users in the United States and complies with applicable U.S. state privacy laws including but not limited to the California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA), Virginia Consumer Data Protection Act (VCDPA), and other state privacy regulations enacted in 2025.

dataCollection.title: 1. Information We Collect
dataCollection.intro: We collect information that you provide directly to us, information we obtain automatically when you use our services, and information from third-party sources.

personalInfo.title: Personal Information
items: Name and contact information
LINE user ID and profile information
Business registration information (for business accounts)
Booking and appointment details
Payment and billing information
Communications with us

automaticInfo.title: Automatically Collected Information
items: Device information (type, operating system, browser)
IP address and geolocation data
Usage data and analytics
Cookies and similar tracking technologies
QR code scan data and timestamps

thirdParty.title: Third-Party Information
items: LINE Corporation (user profile, messaging data)
Payment processors (transaction data)
Analytics providers (usage statistics)

howWeUse.title: 2. How We Use Your Information
howWeUse.intro: We use the information we collect for the following purposes:
items: Provide, operate, and maintain our booking platform
Process appointments and bookings through LINE bot
Send booking confirmations and reminders via LINE messaging
Process payments and manage subscriptions
Provide customer support and respond to inquiries
Analyze usage patterns and improve our services
Send administrative information and service updates
Detect, prevent, and address technical issues or fraud
Comply with legal obligations

dataSharing.title: 3. How We Share Your Information
dataSharing.intro: We may share your information with the following third parties:

serviceProviders.title: Service Providers
serviceProviders.description: We share data with trusted service providers who assist us in operating our platform:
items: LINE Corporation - for messaging and bot services
Neon PostgreSQL - for database hosting
Cloudflare R2 - for file storage (logos, QR codes)
Vercel - for hosting and infrastructure
Stripe - for payment processing
Analytics providers - for service improvement

businessTransfers.title: Business Transfers
businessTransfers.description: If the Company is involved in a merger, acquisition, or sale of assets, your information may be transferred as part of that transaction.

legalRequirements.title: Legal Requirements
legalRequirements.description: We may disclose your information if required by law, court order, or governmental request, or to protect our rights, property, or safety.

withConsent.title: With Your Consent
withConsent.description: We may share your information for other purposes with your explicit consent.

noSale.title: We Do Not Sell Your Personal Information
noSale.description: The Company does not sell your personal information to third parties for monetary consideration.

yourRights.title: 4. Your Privacy Rights
yourRights.intro: Depending on your location in the United States, you may have the following rights regarding your personal information:

rights.title: Right to Know
rights.description: You have the right to request information about the personal data we have collected about you, including categories of data, sources, purposes, and third parties we share it with.

rights.title: Right to Access
rights.description: You can request a copy of your personal information that we maintain.

rights.title: Right to Correct
rights.description: You have the right to request correction of inaccurate personal information.

rights.title: Right to Delete
rights.description: You can request deletion of your personal information, subject to certain exceptions.

rights.title: Right to Opt-Out
rights.description: You have the right to opt-out of the sale of personal information (we do not sell your data), targeted advertising, and certain automated decision-making.

rights.title: Right to Non-Discrimination
rights.description: We will not discriminate against you for exercising any of your privacy rights.

exercise.title: How to Exercise Your Rights
exercise.description: To exercise these rights, you may contact us through your business dashboard settings or by using the LINE bot. We will respond to your request within the timeframes required by applicable law.

dataSecurity.title: 5. Data Security
dataSecurity.description: We implement appropriate technical and organizational security measures to protect your personal information from unauthorized access, disclosure, alteration, or destruction. These measures include:
items: Encryption of data in transit and at rest
Regular security assessments and audits
Access controls and authentication measures
Employee training on data protection
Incident response and breach notification procedures
dataSecurity.disclaimer: However, no method of transmission over the internet or electronic storage is 100% secure. While we strive to protect your information, we cannot guarantee absolute security.

dataRetention.title: 6. Data Retention
dataRetention.description: We retain your personal information for as long as necessary to provide our services and fulfill the purposes outlined in this Privacy Policy. Specific retention periods include:
items: Booking data: Retained for 3 years after the appointment date for business records
Business account data: Retained for the duration of your active subscription plus 1 year
LINE user data: Retained until you unfriend the bot or request deletion
Payment records: Retained for 7 years to comply with tax and accounting requirements
Marketing communications: Retained until you opt-out or request deletion

cookies.title: 7. Cookies and Tracking Technologies
cookies.description: We use cookies and similar tracking technologies to enhance your experience. These include:

types.title: Essential Cookies
types.description: Required for the platform to function properly (session management, authentication).

types.title: Analytics Cookies
types.description: Help us understand how users interact with our platform to improve services.

types.title: Geolocation Data
types.description: We use Vercel Geo detection to automatically detect your region and provide localized content.

types.title: Preference Cookies
types.description: Remember your language and display preferences.

cookies.control: You can control cookies through your browser settings. Note that disabling certain cookies may limit platform functionality.

international.title: 8. International Data Transfers
international.description: Your information may be transferred to and processed in countries other than your country of residence. These countries may have different data protection laws. When we transfer data internationally, we implement appropriate safeguards such as:
items: Standard Contractual Clauses with service providers
Ensuring service providers maintain appropriate security measures
Complying with applicable cross-border data transfer regulations

childrenPrivacy.title: 9. Children's Privacy
childrenPrivacy.description: Our services are not intended for individuals under the age of 18. We do not knowingly collect personal information from children. If you become aware that a child has provided us with personal information, please contact us, and we will take steps to delete such information.

thirdPartyLinks.title: 10. Third-Party Services
thirdPartyLinks.description: Our platform integrates with third-party services, particularly LINE Corporation. Your use of LINE and interactions with the LINE bot are subject to LINE's own privacy policy and terms of service. We are not responsible for the privacy practices of third-party services.

changes.title: 11. Changes to This Privacy Policy
changes.description: We may update this Privacy Policy from time to time to reflect changes in our practices or for legal, operational, or regulatory reasons. We will notify you of material changes by posting the updated policy on our platform and updating the 'Last Updated' date. Continued use of our services after changes constitutes acceptance of the updated policy.

contact.title: 12. Contact Us
contact.description: If you have questions about this Privacy Policy, wish to exercise your privacy rights, or have concerns about how we handle your personal information, please contact us through:
methods: The contact form available on our platform
contact.response: We will respond to your inquiry within 30 days, or as otherwise required by applicable law.

terms.title: Terms of Service
terms.subtitle: Please read these Terms of Service carefully before using our LINE-based booking platform. By accessing or using our services, you agree to be bound by these Terms.
terms.acceptance: By creating an account or using our platform, you acknowledge that you have read, understood, and agree to be bound by these Terms of Service and our Privacy Policy.

items.service: 'Service' or 'Platform' refers to the Kitsune LINE-based booking system, including the web dashboard, LINE bot, and all related services.
items.company: 'Company,' 'we,' 'us,' or 'our' refers to the operator of the Kitsune platform.
items.user: 'You,' 'your,' or 'User' refers to the business entity or individual accessing our services.
items.customer: 'Customer' or 'End User' refers to individuals who make bookings through your LINE bot.
